meta.hint:
Some verbs tell you about something that has already happened.
These verbs tell you about the past. They usually end in -ed.example We walked to the park yesterday.example We looked at the flowers there.
Some verbs are irregular in the past tense. These verbs change their
spelling to tell you about the past. You have to remember what spelling
to use.example We saw some ducks at the park. (See -> Saw)example We ate lunch on the grass. (Eat -> Ate)

content.description: Select the sentence with irregular past tense.
content.extra: I wear my favorite dress,I wore my favorite dress.

content.word: Shalini wrote a letter to her father.
content.description: Select the sentence with irregular past tense.
content.extra: Shalini write a letter to her father,Shalini wrote a letter to her father.
